title: Openeyes
description: OpenEyesâ„¢ is an Electronic Medical Record (EMR) application for ophthalmology, provided under an A-GPL v3 license.
name: Please add container name here

env.label: Openeyes Mode
env.name: OE_MODE
env.description: LIVE mode will hide detailed error messages from the user, not install some development components and and set a few other security hardening options

env.label: Track Commits
env.name: TRACK_NEW_GIT_COMMITS
env.description: If Yes, will automatically update to the latest code from 'Github branch' at regular intervals

env.label: Github Branch
env.name: BUILD_BRANCH
env.description: If you want to deploy a specific git branch (e.g, develop, feature/OE-XXXX, etc)

env.label: Use Demo Data
env.name: USE_DEMO_DATA
env.description: If Yes, will setup some demo patients in the worklist, add some document events, etc (runs all scripts in sample/demo)

env.label: Enable Optom Portal
env.name: OE_PORTAL_ENABLED
env.description: If Yes, will enable polling for data from the optom portal every 5 minutes. Note that you must also configure the Optom Potal user, password, urls, client id and client key for this to actually work

env.label: Instituiton Code (optional)
env.name: OE_INSTITUTION_CODE
env.description: The ODS institution code for the customer (e.g, RP6 = Moorfields) (optional - only really needed if Enable Optom Portal is 'Yes')

env.label: Optom portal API URL (optional)
env.name: OE_PORTAL_URI
env.description: To use the optom portal, you must set the correct API endpoint uri (optional - only used if Enable Optom Portal is Yes)

env.label: Optom portal External URL (optional)
env.name: OE_PORTAL_EXTERNAL_URI
env.description: This is the URL that will get printed in letters / onscreen instructions for the optom portal (optional - only used if Enable Optom Portal is Yes)

env.label: Optom portal username (optional)
env.name: OE_PORTAL_USERNAME
env.description: Username for optom portal user (optional - only used if Enable Optom Portal is Yes)

env.label: Optom portal password (optional)
env.name: OE_PORTAL_PASSWORD
env.description: Password for optom portal user (optional - only used if Enable Optom Portal is Yes)

env.label: Optom portal client ID (optional)
env.name: OE_PORTAL_CLIENT_ID
env.description: API Client ID string for the optom portal (optional - only used if Enable Optom Portal is Yes)

env.label: Optom portal client secret (optional)
env.name: OE_PORTAL_CLIENT_SECRET
env.description: API Client sectret for the optom portal (optional - only used if Enable Optom Portal is Yes)

env.label: Docman Export directory (optional)
env.name: OE_DOCMAN_EXPORT_DIRECTORY
env.description: The directory that generated PDF files for Docman will be saved to. If left blank, Docman will be disabled (optional - only really needed if Enable Docmanis is Yes)

env.label: Signature app URL (optional)
env.name: OE_SIGNATURE_APP_URL
env.description: The url that users are directed to for capturing signatures -e.g., for eCVI (optional - only really needed if Enable Docman Yes)

env.label: Time Zone
env.name: TZ
env.description: Override the time zone (for international users) - uses standard Unix timezone identifiers
